intro: Spiraea aruncus var. hermaphrodita, commonly known as the European meadow-spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features dense clusters of white to pink flower clusters in early summer. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish fruits in the fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or stream banks. This variety is notable for its showy floral display and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
